conclusion.finding: Larger perturbation scales (0.08, 0.10) do NOT improve over baseline (0.05)
conclusion.evidence: Scale 0.05 achieved 1.1549, scale 0.08 achieved 1.1469, scale 0.10 achieved 1.1506 - all within noise

hypothesis: Current 0.05 perturbation scale may be too small. Larger jumps (0.08, 0.10) may reach better basins.

prior_evidence.adaptive_perturbation_scale: FAILED - Adaptive scaling based on RMSE didn't help
prior_evidence.note: But this tests LARGER fixed scales, not adaptive

machine_note: WARNING: This machine runs 4.5x slower than baseline. Times will be inflated.
